channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Student who tested positive an undisclosed contact, Hipkins says
item.description: Health Minister Chris Hipkins says it has become apparent some close contacts of the Mt Roskill Evangelical Fellowship church sub-cluster were not previously disclosed, including a student that recently tested positive.

item.title: Auckland secondary school principals say NCEA changes 'a sense of relief'
item.description: Auckland secondary school principals are confident changes to the NCEA will ease the stress on their students - but they've got a warning, too.

item.title: AA calls for roadside alcohol testing to ramp up to previous levels
item.description: About a third of all fatal crashes in New Zealand involve someone under the influence of alcohol or drugs, but roadside testing has dropped off significantly in recent years.

item.title: Auckland school closed after student tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: St Dominic's Catholic College in Auckland will be closed for at least three days after a student tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Possible 'driving test' for wedding celebrants on the way
item.description: Prospective wedding celebrants will be required to run a mock ceremony and newly-weds will be asked for their feedback.

item.title: Research challenges warmth, efficiency of Homestar properties
item.description: A stoush has broken out over new research that challenges whether green-certified homes are actually warmer, drier and healthier than typical new builds, as has been claimed.

item.title: Scots College takes stand against students' homophobic content
item.description: A Wellington school has criticised the actions of students who used homophobic language and images in videos posted on social media.

item.title: Comancheros trial: $1m drug deal fell through moments from completion, court told
item.description: The trial of five people linked to the Comancheros gang has been told how close a large drug deal came to being completed in the Auckland suburb of Takanini.

item.title: Phil Goff tells Aucklanders: 'Be a tidy Kiwi' and dispose of single-use masks correctly
item.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff is calling on Aucklanders to dispose of single-use masks correctly, following reports council staff are finding hundreds littered throughout the city.

item.title: Covid-19: NGO sector hit hard, 'existential threat' for some agencies - report
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic has created an "existential threat" to some agencies, and almost half fear they will shut down, a new report reveals.

item.title: Teenagers plead guilty to manslaughter of 90-year-old Grace Virtue
item.description: Three teenagers have pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of 90-year-old Grace Virtue, who died of a brain injury after a home invasion last year.

item.title: Official Information Act request delays prompt more complaints
item.description: Despite this, the Ombudsman says a recent small drop in complaints is a "good result" with Covid-19.

item.title: Warning after disturbing content circulates on social media
item.description: Netsafe is issuing warnings to schools and parents after a disturbing video was shared on social media.

item.title: Japan's search for crew of capsized cattle ship still suspended
item.description: Japan's coastguard says its search-and-rescue mission for 40 missing crew from a capsized cattle ship in the East China Sea remains suspended.

item.title: Māori disappointed bowel screening age will not be lowered
item.description: Māori bowel cancer patients are disappointed the Ministry of Health will not drop the national screening programme eligibility age to 50 for Māori and Pasifika.

item.title: Iwi faces tricky balancing act in upgrading Swiss Alpine style lodge
item.description: A South Taranaki iwi is wrestling with a nice to have problem - how to spend $3 million in government funding.

item.title: Support, criticism, confusion around Matariki as public holiday
item.description: A woman who set up a petition to make Matariki a public holiday says it will be a chance for all New Zealanders to learn about indigenous science and spirituality.

item.title: Māori Battalion war medals to be claimed after 75 years
item.description: The never-received war medals of soldiers in the Māori Battalion's C Company are about to be claimed for the first time in 75 years.
